what: Stacked percent bar chart for two categorical variables — plot_2_categorical_vars
title: Stacked percent bar chart for two categorical variables — plot_2_categorical_vars
text: Create stacked percent bar chart x categorical variable broken second categorical variable. plot includes within-group percentages, group sample sizes bar, (optionally) subtitle showing Cramer's V test p-value.

title: Stacked percent bar chart for two categorical variables — plot_2_categorical_vars
code: plot_2_categorical_vars(   d,   xvar,   yvar,   xvar_label = NULL,   yvar_label = NULL,   yvar_colors = NULL,   title = NULL,   title_nchar_wrap = 30,   show_effect_size = TRUE,   n_pct_size = 3.5,   pct_digits = 0,   plot_horizontal = FALSE,   flip = FALSE,   xaxis_labels_nchar_wrap = 20,   y_max = 110,   n_ypos = y_max - 5 )

title: Stacked percent bar chart for two categorical variables — plot_2_categorical_vars
text: d data.frame containing variables. xvar Character scalar, name categorical x variable (column d). yvar Character scalar, name categorical y variable (column d). xvar_label Optional character scalar use x axis label. yvar_label Optional character scalar use legend label. yvar_colors Optional character vector colours use y-variable levels. Must length equal nlevels(d[[yvar]]). Provide colour names (e.g. "red") hex codes (e.g. "#FF0000"). NULL (default) ggplot2's default palette used. title Optional character scalar plot title. title_nchar_wrap Integer scalar. Maximum number characters per line title. show_effect_size Logical; TRUE subtitle include Cramer's V p-value. n_pct_size Numeric scalar. Point size used percent labels inside stacked bars group N labels bars. Must single positive numeric value. pct_digits Integer scalar (default 0). Number decimal places show within-group percent labels (e.g. 0 => "12%", 1 => "12.3%"). Must single non-negative numeric value. plot_horizontal Logical scalar. Deprecated/alias flip. TRUE plot shown horizontal bars. Prefer using flip. flip Logical scalar (default FALSE). TRUE plot flipped show horizontal bars. xaxis_labels_nchar_wrap Integer scalar. Maximum number characters per line x-axis group labels. Longer labels wrapped multiple lines. y_max Numeric scalar. Maximum y-axis limit plot. n_ypos Numeric scalar. y-axis position group N labels.

title: Stacked percent bar chart for two categorical variables — plot_2_categorical_vars
text: list ggplot2 object, Cramer's V effect size, p-value.

title: Stacked percent bar chart for two categorical variables — plot_2_categorical_vars
code: data(mtcars) mtcars$cyl <- factor(mtcars$cyl) mtcars$gear <- factor(mtcars$gear) p <- plot_2_categorical_vars(   d = mtcars,   xvar = "cyl",   yvar = "gear",   xvar_label = 'Cylinders',   yvar_label = 'Gears' ) p$ggplot

title: Bar plot by group — plot_bars
text: Create grouped bar plot (geom_col) data frame. Reorders factor levels xvar yvar (descending) maps fill xvar. Accepts named unnamed color vector; unnamed vectors must match number groups.

title: Bar plot by group — plot_bars
code: plot_bars(   dat,   yvar,   xvar,   colors = NULL,   sort = c("desc", "asc", "none"),   title = NULL,   xvar_label = NULL,   yvar_label = NULL,   show_legend = FALSE )

title: Bar plot by group — plot_bars
text: dat data.frame containing data plot. yvar Character. Name numeric outcome column. xvar Character. Name grouping column (coerced/reordered factor). colors Optional character vector fill colours. named, names match group levels. unnamed, length must equal number groups. Missing group names filled "black". sort Character. sort bars: "desc" descending, "asc" ascending, "none" reordering. title Optional plot title xvar_label Optional character label x variable. NULL label obtained using labelled::get_variable_labels(). yvar_label Optional character label y variable. NULL label obtained using labelled::get_variable_labels(). show_legend Logical. Whether show legend fill colors. Default FALSE.

title: Bar plot by group — plot_bars
code: dat <- data.frame(group = c("A", "B", "C"), score = c(5, 3, 8)) plot_bars(dat, yvar = "score", xvar = "group", sort = "desc")

what: Plot effect-size estimates and confidence intervals. All values must be between 0 and 1. — plot_effectsize_01_intervals
title: Plot effect-size estimates and confidence intervals. All values must be between 0 and 1. — plot_effectsize_01_intervals
text: Create horizontal interval plot effect-size estimates (values 0 1) lower/upper confidence bounds. y-axis shows effect labels x-axis gives effect size values.

title: Plot effect-size estimates and confidence intervals. All values must be between 0 and 1. — plot_effectsize_01_intervals
code: plot_effectsize_01_intervals(   d,   variable_name,   value_name,   group_name = NULL,   group_label = group_name,   colors = NULL,   xaxis_label = "Effect size",   lower_name = "lower",   upper_name = "upper",   title = "Effect size estimates with 95% confidence intervals",   sort = TRUE,   descending = FALSE,   dot_size = 3 )

title: Plot effect-size estimates and confidence intervals. All values must be between 0 and 1. — plot_effectsize_01_intervals
text: d data.frame: data containing effect labels, estimates bounds. variable_name character(1): column name d variable names y-axis. value_name character(1): column name d estimates (numeric, expected 0..1). group_name character(1) NULL: optional column name d used color points/lines group. group_label character(1) NULL: label show legend group_name used. Defaults group_name. colors character(1) NULL: optional character vector (named character vector) colours map groups; names match group values. NULL (default) uses ggplot2 defaults. xaxis_label character(1): label x axis (default "Effect size"). lower_name character(1): column name d CI lower bound (numeric, default "lower"). upper_name character(1): column name d CI upper bound (numeric, default "upper"). title character(1): plot title (default "Effect size estimates 95% confidence intervals"). sort logical: sort rows estimate plotting (default TRUE). descending logical: TRUE place largest estimates top (default TRUE). dot_size numeric(1): size points (default 3). Use smaller values make points less prominent relative CI lines.

title: Plot effect-size estimates and confidence intervals. All values must be between 0 and 1. — plot_effectsize_01_intervals
text: ggplot object (horizontal interval plot).

title: Plot effect-size estimates and confidence intervals. All values must be between 0 and 1. — plot_effectsize_01_intervals
code: df <- data.frame(   effect = paste0("Effect ", LETTERS[1:5]),   estimate = c(0.12, 0.35, 0.58, 0.74, 0.91),   lower = c(0.05, 0.22, 0.45, 0.60, 0.82),   upper = c(0.20, 0.47, 0.69, 0.85, 0.97),   group = rep(c("One","Two"), length.out = 5) )  # Example with no group colors plot_effectsize_01_intervals(   d = df,   variable_name = "effect",   value_name = "estimate",   lower_name = "lower",   upper_name = "upper" )   # Example with group colors plot_effectsize_01_intervals(   d = df,   variable_name = "effect",   value_name = "estimate",   group_name = "group",   group_label = "My groups",   lower_name = "lower",   upper_name = "upper",   dot_size = 1.5 )

title: Violin + boxplot of a numeric variable by a grouping factor — plot_numeric_by_group
code: plot_numeric_by_group(   yvar,   group,   d,   yvar_label = NULL,   group_label = NULL,   title = NULL,   group_colors = NULL,   show_effect_size = TRUE,   n_boot = 1000,   xaxis_labels_nchar_wrap = 20 )

title: Violin + boxplot of a numeric variable by a grouping factor — plot_numeric_by_group
text: yvar Character scalar. Column name (d) numeric variable plot. Must length 1 refer numeric column d. group Character scalar. Column name (d) grouping factor. Must length 1 refer factor column d. d data.frame containing variables. yvar_label Optional character scalar y-axis label. Defaults yvar. supplied, must length 1. group_label Optional character scalar x-axis label. Defaults group. supplied, must length 1. title Optional character scalar plot title. Defaults "<yvar> <group>". supplied, must length 1. group_colors Optional character vector colours use grouping levels. Must length equal nlevels(d[[group]]) supplied. Use colour names hex codes. show_effect_size Logical scalar. TRUE subtitle include epsilon-squared p-value. n_boot Integer-like numeric scalar. Number bootstrap samples estimating CI epsilon-squared. Default 2000. Must single numeric value >= 100. xaxis_labels_nchar_wrap Numeric scalar. Maximum line width (number characters) used wrap group labels x-axis appending sample size. Defaults 20. Must single positive numeric value.

what: Kaplan–Meier plot from a Surv object — plot_survival_curves
title: Kaplan–Meier plot from a Surv object — plot_survival_curves
text: Plot Kaplan–Meier curve (confidence intervals risk table) using supplied Surv object. grouping variable exactly two levels function fits Cox model annotates hazard ratio (95% CI) p-value; two groups displays log‑rank p-value.

title: Kaplan–Meier plot from a Surv object — plot_survival_curves
code: plot_survival_curves(   surv_obj,   data,   group_var = "met_exercise_guidelines",   time_limits = NULL,   x_breaks = NULL,   annotate_y = 0.99,   annotate_x = NULL,   x_label = "Time (units??)",   y_label = NULL,   title = NULL,   custom_hr_pvalue_text = NULL,   type = c("survival", "risk") )

title: Kaplan–Meier plot from a Surv object — plot_survival_curves
text: surv_obj Surv object (can right‑censored left‑truncated). data data frame containing variables referenced surv_obj group_var. group_var Character, name grouping column data. time_limits Numeric(2), x-axis limits plot (default c(50, 100)). x_breaks Numeric, breaks x axis. annotate_y Numeric, y position annotation text (default 0.99). annotate_x Numeric NULL, x position annotation; NULL uses rightmost time_limits. x_label Character, label x axis (default \"Time\"). y_label Character, label y axis (default \"Probability Event-free\"). title Character NULL, plot title (default NULL). custom_hr_pvalue_text Character NULL; provided, string used annotation instead automatically computed HR/p-value (two groups) log‑rank p-value (>2 groups). type Character, one "survival" "risk"; passed ggsurvfit(). "survival" default y_label "Probability Event-Free"; "risk" default y_label "Probability Event".

title: Kaplan–Meier plot from a Surv object — plot_survival_curves
text: ggplot object (ggsurvfit).

title: Kaplan–Meier plot from a Surv object — plot_survival_curves
code: data(cancer, package = "survival")  # Example with two groups lung$sex <- factor(lung$sex, labels = c("Male", "Female")) surv_obj <- with(lung, survival::Surv(time, status == 2)) plot_survival_curves(surv_obj, lung, group_var = "sex")   # Example with more than two groups lung$ph.ecog[lung$ph.ecog == 3] <- NA lung$ph.ecog <- factor(lung$ph.ecog) surv_obj <- with(lung, survival::Surv(time, status == 2)) plot_survival_curves(surv_obj, lung, group_var = "ph.ecog")   # Cumulative incidence plot plot_survival_curves(surv_obj, lung, group_var = "ph.ecog")
